Transcription for 996871

The Lord, my shepherd, I'll not want, He makes me down to lie.
In master's dream He leadeth me The quiet waters wide.
I saw the earth restore a year, And need to walk that day,
Within the bounds of righteousness, Before His own name say.
Even though I walk through Westarkville, Yet will I feel the hill,
For the heart with me can by God, And set me come for still.
My field of grass that perishes, In presence of my God,
My head of grass, with all life and life, Can by the fulcrum flow.
Goodness and mercy, all my life, Shall surely follow me,
And in God's love forevermore, Like wedding plates shall be.
